intro: Listrostachys ringens, commonly known as the white-flowered rock orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers during the spring and early summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. It is often found in high-altitude environments where it adapts to cool and moist conditions. The botanical features of Listrostachys ringens make it a unique and ornamental species in alpine flora.
